comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

pull_request.title: Fix #149538 simpleanalyticscdn.com
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

Add two domains to tracker blocklist:

- simpleanalyticscdn.com
- simpleanalyticsexternal.com

Tested as custom filtering rules for a few months, they appear to work without any issues.

Domains are based on Simple Analytics documentation and network observations.

- https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/script
- https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/bypass-ad-blockers

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [x] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [ ] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

<https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/149538>

issue.title: Add simpleanalyticscdn.com to tracking_servers.txt
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Analytics tracker *Simple Analytics* isn't currently blocked by the trackers filter.

Their [documentation](https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/script) shows the service uses `scripts.simpleanalyticscdn.com` and `queue.simpleanalyticscdn.com`.

They also suggest clients make a CNAME record pointing to `simpleanalyticsexternal.com` from the first-party domain. I'm not sure if AdGuard would block this, but I added the `simpleanalyticsexternal.com` domain too.

### Proposed solution

Proposing to add simpleanalyticscdn.com and simpleanalyticsexternal.com to the trackers filter.

I'll send a PR shortly, making this bug for tracking. I've been using the proposed filters for a few months, and haven't noticed anything breaking.

```
||simpleanalyticscdn.com^
||simpleanalyticsexternal.com^
```

### Additional information

_No response_

comment.body:
> @@||securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/tag/js/gpt.js$script,domain=thecubexguide.com|djxmaza.in
> @@||securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/pagead/managed/js/gpt/*/pubads_impl$script,domain=thecubexguide.com|djxmaza.in
> @@||securepubads.g.doubleclick.net/gampad/ads$xhr,domain=thecubexguide.com|djxmaza.in
> *$frame,domain=djxmaza.in,redirect=noopframe
> djxmaza.in,thecubexguide.com#@#iframe
> djxmaza.in,thecubexguide.com##iframe:style(height: 0px !important)
> djxmaza.in,thecubexguide.com##[class^="stickyads"]:remove()
> *$subdocument,redirect-rule=noopframe,domain=djxmaza.in
> *$xmlhttprequest,redirect-rule=nooptext,domain=djxmaza.in
> @@||djxmaza.in^$generichide,important

This trick seems to work!
Thank you!!!

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/148855#issuecomment-1519181266 - Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce it.

Please try to add this rule:
```adblock
flickr.com#@#div[class^="view sub-photo-right-view"] > div.photo-charm-exif-scrappy-view + div
```
to user rules and then check if issue still occurs.

comment.body:
This issue is has been escalated to [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra):
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra/issues/393

Please wait until it is solved there.

If you’re using AdGuard for Windows, Mac or Android, you’re probably already using AdGuard Extra so you just need to wait until it is updated.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

<hr>

You can also take a look here - https://github.com/MasterKia/PersianBlocker/issues/40

pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

Fix a broken URL to the reporting tool in the Github templates.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

- https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/149541

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

issue.title: diecourant.co.za
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [https://diecourant.co.za/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdiecourant.co.za%2F) ### Comment Username: @DandelionSprout > Various ads, as well as inline scripts that block right-clicking and text copying. I propose: > ``` > ! https://diecourant.co.za/ (Screenshot 1) > ! Ads > diecourant.co.za##section[id^=smartslider] > diecourant.co.za###secondary > ! Anti-copy scripts > I've identified inline scripts with the IDs "wpcp_disable_selection", "wpcp_disable_Right_Click", and "wpcp-error-message", likely requiring scriptlets to fix, potentially generic ones. > ! https://diecourant.co.za/2023/01/23/sekondere-skoolonderrig-so-lyk-2023-se-fooie/ (Screenshot 2) > I'm stumped on how to fix these without blocking the non-ad graphs. > ``` > The site appears to be in Afrikaans. I did some Afrikaans-Dutch text comparison in Google Translate to see if EasyDutch (uBO's main Dutch list) would be likely to cover it, and I concluded with "Doubtful"; and I recall EasyList Dutch have been sceptical to cover such sites before. ### Screenshots

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

4.0

Missed analytics or tracker

Microsoft Edge

Mobile

https://www.pacsun.com/new-arrivals/mens/

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Widgets filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard DNS filter

_No response_

issue.title: Fix reporting tool URL in Github templates
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

In several templates in the `.github` directory, the reporting tool is referred to with a URL that redirects to the KB homepage.

- https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool


### Proposed solution

Replace broken URL with working one used elsewhere in the documentation: 

- https://kb.adguard.com/technical-support/reporting-tool

Note that it differs from the above URL by omitting the `/en/`

### Additional information

I'll send a PR to address this shortly.

issue.title: Add simpleanalyticscdn.com to tracking_servers.txt
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer;
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed;
- [X] This is not an ad/bug report.

### Problem description

Analytics tracker *Simple Analytics* isn't currently blocked by the trackers filter.

Their [documentation](https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/script) shows the service uses `scripts.simpleanalyticscdn.com` and `queue.simpleanalyticscdn.com`.

They also suggest clients make a CNAME record pointing to `simpleanalyticsexternal.com` from the first-party domain. I'm not sure if AdGuard would block this, but I added the `simpleanalyticsexternal.com` domain too.

### Proposed solution

Proposing to add simpleanalyticscdn.com and simpleanalyticsexternal.com to the trackers filter.

I'll send a PR shortly, making this bug for tracking. I've been using the proposed filters for a few months, and haven't noticed anything breaking.

```
||simpleanalyticscdn.com^
||simpleanalyticsexternal.com^
```

### Additional information

_No response_

commits.message:
Fix/149541 Update URLs in Github templates (#149542)

* Fix #149538 simpleanalyticscdn.com

Add two domains to tracker blocklist:

- simpleanalyticscdn.com
- simpleanalyticsexternal.com

Tested as custom filtering rules for a few months, they appear to work
without any issues.

Domains are based on Simple Analytics documentation and network
observations.

- https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/script
- https://docs.simpleanalytics.com/bypass-ad-blockers

* Fix #149541 Update reporting tool URL in Github templates

* Update SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers.txt

Co-authored-by: krystian3w <35370833+krystian3w@users.noreply.github.com>

* Update SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers.txt

Co-authored-by: krystian3w <35370833+krystian3w@users.noreply.github.com>

---------

Co-authored-by: Cat Lee Ball 🎶🎷🐀 <git@catball.dev>
Co-authored-by: krystian3w <35370833+krystian3w@users.noreply.github.com>

# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;

- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

Fix a broken URL to the reporting tool in the Github templates.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

- https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/149541

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

Missed ads or ad leftovers

Firefox

Desktop

https://jp.mercari.com/search?keyword=ddr4%2064&status=on_sale&exclude_keyword=16gb%208gb&sort=price&order=asc&category_id=1156

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, EasyList

_No response_

![screenshot](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/103918092/235069135-71652b13-bc0d-4318-a7c7-aaaa286d9f3e.png)

</details>

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.12

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Enter a hot bilibili live broadcast room to reproduce

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>
bilibili's live broadcast room will carry out p2p upload. use "live.bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('nowebrtc')" can stop it.
2. Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69903376/232044513-1a81bb50-9261-43c9-9ccf-fedf6be83192.png)

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

У меня открывается схема зала.
Вы включили очень много фильтров, к тому же используете несколько блокировщиков.
Если проблему вызывает лишь Адгард - попробуйте проверить без сторонних фильтров методом исключения.

### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

7.12

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

Enter a hot bilibili live broadcast room to reproduce

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Chinese filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Social Media filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

bilibili's live broadcast room will carry out p2p upload. use "live.bilibili.com#%#//scriptlet('nowebrtc')" can stop it.
